intro: Armeria × cintrana, commonly known as the hybrid sea thrift, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cariandraceae. It is a low-growing perennial that forms dense mats of silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. It is native to coastal areas of western Europe and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Armeria × cintrana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in harsh, maritime conditions.
